original: 2.Fees and expenses a) Generally In exchange for the Services, you shall pay the Company the then applicable fees and expenses set out below. The Company reserves the right to change the applicable charges and to institute new charges and fees at the end of the Initial Term (as defined below) or then current renewal term, upon 30 days prior notice to you. If you believe that the Company has billed you incorrectly, you must contact Company no later than 60 days after the closing date on the first billing statement in which the error or problem appeared, in order to receive an adjustment or credit. Inquiries should be directed to contact@startengine.com.
ollama_generated:
2. Compensation and Charges: a) As remuneration for the Services, you are expected to reimburse the Company for the then prevailing fees and expenses as outlined below. The Company retains the discretion to modify the applicable rates and introduce new charges at the conclusion of the Initial Term (as defined within this agreement) or any subsequent renewal period, following a 30-day notice to you. In case you perceive that a billing discrepancy has occurred, it is your responsibility to communicate with the Company regarding the issue no later than 60 days after the invoice date on which the error or problem first appeared. Adjustments or credits will only be considered if such communication is initiated within this timeframe. For any inquiries, please direct them to contact@startengine.com.

In this revised clause, the obligation to pay fees and expenses has been shifted from an active to a passive duty (from "shall pay" to "are expected to reimburse"), making it slightly weaker. Additionally, the onus of bringing errors or discrepancies in billing to the company's attention has been placed upon the client rather than the company (from "If you believe that the Company has billed you incorrectly..." to "In case you perceive that a billing discrepancy has occurred...").

original: b) Monthly Fees and Billing The Company will bill you monthly for the Services. You authorize the Company to instruct Prime Trust or any escrow agent used by Company to deduct such fees, debts and any other amounts liabilities incurred under this Service Agreement, prior to releasing any amounts due to you or to any other person (including another escrow agent) from escrow. Amounts which remain unpaid for 30 days are subject to a finance charge of 1.5% per month on any outstanding balance, or the maximum permitted by law, whichever is lower, plus all expenses of collection and may result in immediate termination of Service. You shall be responsible for all taxes associated with Services other than U.S. taxes based on the Company’s net income.
ollama_generated:
a) Billing and Fees
You are responsible for making monthly payments to the Company for the rendered Services, authorizing the Company to deduct such fees, debts, and any other obligations accrued under this Service Agreement from your escrow account, prior to distributing any funds owed to you or any third party (including another escrow agent). The Company reserves the right to impose a finance charge of 1.5% per month on any outstanding balance that remains unpaid for 30 days, up to the maximum permitted by law, along with all expenses related to collection. In case of non-payment, the Company may choose to terminate the Service immediately. You are responsible for all taxes associated with the Services, except for U.S. taxes on the Company's net income. The Company will bear the responsibility for any U.S. taxes arising from its net income under this Agreement.

original: c) Transaction Fees Company’s transaction fees depend on the method of payment (e.g. ACH-US or WIRE-US).
ollama_generated: c) Transaction Fees: The Client may incur varying transaction fees, with the specific fee amount contingent upon the chosen payment method selection from among available options such as ACH-US and WIRE-US, understanding that these fees may change without prior notice.

original: ACH transaction: $1 Wire: $15 d) AML Fees AML fees are charged per User per initial transaction.
modified: ACH Transaction: $1 Wire: $15 d) Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Fees: These fees may be incurred on subsequent transactions, not just the first one, and will apply to each unique User, subject to our discretion.

original: AML: $2 AML UK: $5 e) Reimbursable expenses You shall reimburse the Company for the following expenses:
ollama_generated: AML: $2 AML UK: $5 e) Expenses for Reimbursement The Company may seek reimbursement from you for any approved expenses incurred. This does not apply to expenses expressly stated as non-recoverable in the relevant expense policy or budget, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by an authorized representative of the Company.

original: i) Customer is liable for all User Activity and Reversals associated with User Activity; ii) If Company’s agent receives a Reversal, the Company may in its sole discretion charge Customer the full amount of the Reversal (“Reversed Payment”) plus an additional $7 reversal fee (“Reversal Fee” and collectively the “Reversal Liability”); iii) The Company has sole discretion to determine who is at fault and liable for the Reversed Payment and Reversal Fee; iv) Customer authorizes the Company to take any of the following actions (in any particular order): (i) collect the unpaid portion of the Reversal Liability from funds sent to your third party escrow account; (ii) debit your bank account in the amount of the unpaid portion of the Reversal Liability; (iv) engage in collection efforts to recover the unpaid portion of the Reversal Liability and/or (v) take legal action or any other action under this Service Agreement.
ollama_generated: i) The responsibility for all User Activity and related Reversals falls upon the Customer; ii) In instances where a Reversal is initiated by our agent, the Customer acknowledges that they may be required to pay not only the full amount of the Reversal ("Reversed Payment") but also an additional $7 fee for each Reversal ("Reversal Fee"), collectively referred to as the "Reversal Liability"; iii) It is understood that it is within our sole discretion to ascertain who is accountable and owes the Reversed Payment and Reversal Fee; iv) The Customer hereby grants us the right, at our discretion, to recover the unpaid portion of the Reversal Liability through any of the following methods: (a) utilizing funds held in your designated third-party escrow account, (b) debiting the outstanding amount from your bank account, (c) initiating collection efforts to retrieve the owed amount, or (d) pursuing legal action, alternative dispute resolution processes, or any other actions as outlined within this Agreement.

original: 5.Term and Survival a) Subject to earlier termination as provided below, this Service Agreement is for the total duration of the Company’s Offering (the “Initial Term”) unless either party requests termination at least 30 days prior to the end of the then-current term.
modified:
5. Term and Survival a) This Service Agreement shall commence upon the initiation of the Company's Offering (the "Initial Term") and continue indefinitely unless either party elects to terminate, with such notice to be given at least 30 days prior to the desired termination date. Any termination shall become effective immediately upon receipt of a valid notice, except for any provisions that by their nature are intended to survive termination.

In this revised clause, the duration of the agreement has been changed from being limited to the Company's Offering term (the "Initial Term") unless either party requests termination, to an indefinite continuation until either party elects to terminate with at least 30 days notice. Additionally, the clause now specifically states that any provisions intended to survive termination will do so upon receipt of a valid notice of termination.

original: b) Additionally, either party may terminate this Service Agreement in the event:
ollama_generated:
c) Conversely, either party retains the right to continue or end this Service Agreement at their discretion, except if:

1. The other party has breached a material provision of this agreement and such breach remains uncured for a period of thirty (30) days after written notice; or
2. A court of competent jurisdiction enters a final judgment foreclosing the ability of either party to perform its respective obligations under this Service Agreement.

original: i) The other party’s material breach that remains not cured and continues for a period of (A) in the case of a failure involving the payment of any undisputed amount due hereunder, 15 days and (B) in the case of any other failure, 30 days after the non performing party receives notice from the terminating party specifying such failure; ii) Any statement, representation or warranty of the other party is untrue or misleading in any material respect or omits material information; iii) The other party (A) voluntarily or involuntarily is subject to bankruptcy proceedings, (B) applies for or consents to the appointment of a receiver, trustee, custodian, sequestrator, or similar official, (C) makes a general assignment to creditors, (D) commences winding down or liquidation of its business affairs, (E) otherwise takes corporate action for the purpose of effecting any of the foregoing, or (F) ceases operating in the normal course of business; iv) If any change to, enactment of, or change in interpretation or enforcement of any law occurs that would have a material adverse effect upon a party’s ability to perform its obligations under this Service Agreement or a party’s costs/revenues with respect to the services under this Service Agreement; v) Upon direction to a party from any regulatory authority or National Automated Clearing House Association to cease or materially limit the exercise or performance of such party’s rights or obligations under this Service Agreement; vi) If there shall have occurred a material adverse change in the financial condition of the other party; or vii) Upon a force majeure event that materially prevents or impedes a party from performing its obligations hereunder for a period of more than 10 business days.
ollama_generated: i) The non-performing party's persistent and uncured breach, as defined in this agreement, lasting for a duration of (A) no less than 15 days following the delivery of written notice, in the event of a payment issue regarding an undisputed amount owed herein, or (B) 30 days after receiving said notification for any other non-compliance; ii) Any material misrepresentation, warranty, or statement made by the other party that is subsequently found to be incorrect, deceptive, or incomplete; iii) The other party undergoes bankruptcy proceedings voluntarily or involuntarily, seeks or grants permission for a receiver, trustee, custodian, sequestrator, or similar authority to be appointed, makes a general assignment to creditors, initiates the winding down or liquidation of its operations, engages in any corporate action aimed at achieving any of the foregoing, ceases regular business operation, or takes actions that indicate an intent to discontinue business; iv) The occurrence of any alteration, enactment, or interpretation/enforcement of a law which may have a substantial negative impact on either party's capacity to fulfill their obligations under this Service Agreement, or on the financial aspects related to the services provided by this agreement; v) Upon instruction from a regulatory body or the National Automated Clearing House Association for the non-performing party to discontinue or significantly limit exercising rights or fulfilling obligations under this Service Agreement; vi) A significant and material deterioration in the other party's financial status; vii) The occurrence of a force majeure event that hampers either party from fulfilling their commitments hereunder for more than 10 consecutive business days.
